at.fhv.roomanizer.domain.room
Class Category

java.lang.Object
  at.fhv.roomanizer.domain.room.Category
All Implemented Interfaces:
ICategory
Direct Known Subclasses:
CategoryAdapter
public class Category
extends java.lang.Object
implements ICategory

Every room must be a member of a category. The category is asked if we want to know if rooms are available. Categorys are the deciding factor when deciding about pricing, but prices are stored in the Price class and are depending of the actual season.

Author:
Shady

checkAvailability

public java.util.List<Room> checkAvailability(java.util.Date start,
                                              java.util.Date end,
                                              int amount)
Check every room in this category for the availability in the given timespan. The goal is to return as much rooms as given in the amount-parameter. If there arent enough rooms available, we return null.

Parameters:
start - StartDate of the availability
end - EndDate of the availability
amount - Amount of needed rooms in this category and timespan
Returns:
List of available rooms
